page.title: 12The 3 churches of Ousden
page.content: There are 3 places of worship in the village. The church dedicated to St Peter is a tri-partite Norman building. Although there have been later additions some Norman features remain. The rector is also rector of the nearby villages of Lydgate and Cowlinge and resident in Lydgate. A lay elder, assistant lives in Ousden. The congregation numbers around 12 and work is done to raise funds to keep the church fabric in good repair. The surrounding churchyard ceased to be used for burials in 1912, when a new cemetary was opened. The cemetery chapel of St Barnabas was built at about this time. The Methodist chapel built in 1872 replaceing the old barn at Dunstall Green has a congregation of 8. There is no resident minister as it is part of the Newmarket curcuit, who supply a minister when required.
